trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based on the identity of a Windows domain or user account.

Typically, application developers do not need to use the WindowsSecurityToken class, unless a Web service must gain access to details about the Windows domain or user account associated with the WindowsSecurityToken security token.
To get the details of the Windows domain or user account, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class.
This constructor does nothing, by default.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the Windows user.

This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
windowsIdentity is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the Windows user.
This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Initialize%2A> method to initialize the properties of this class.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
A unique identifier for the security token.
windowsIdentity is .
-or- id is .
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
A unique identifier for the security token.
The authentication type for the security token.
Gets the authentication type for the token.
Returns <xref:System.String>.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
Call the Dispose method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>.
The Dispose method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> in an unusable state.

After calling the Dispose method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call the Dispose method before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets the unique identifier for the security token.
A unique identifier for the security token.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified unique identifier, Windows user, and the first and last instants in time when the security token is valid.
The Initialize method is called by the constructors for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class.
A unique identifier for the security token.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id*> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Set the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidFrom*> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidTo*> property.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity*> property.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to create a <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> object that is identical to the `windowsIdentity` parameter and assign that to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity*> property; otherwise, assign the value of the `windowsIdentity` parameter to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity*> property.
windowsIdentity is .
-or- id is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class.
A unique identifier for the security token.
The authentication type for the security token.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Represents a Windows user.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to create a <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> object that is identical to the `windowsIdentity` parameter and assign that to the `WindowsIdentity` property; otherwise, assign the value of the `windowsIdentity` parameter to the `WindowsIdentity` property.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
The SecurityKeys method returns an empty collection, by default.
A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Throws an exception if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose*> method has been called for this instance.
the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose*> method has been called for this instance.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The ValidFrom property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token is valid for 10 hours, by default.
The ValidTo property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created plus 10 hours.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
